page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: Eastwick School no longer exists as a school; its building is now used for agricultural purposes. Roydon County Primary School still remains in its nineteenth century buildings which have been cleverly modernised. During the period of the great bulge in primary school population during the 1960s addition- al temporary hutted classrooms were built in the grounds and these still exist. This school is just out of our area, however. A temporary school, Springhills County Primary, was built in the Little Parndon area to assist over- population of the Little Parndon County Junior and Infants schools during the bulge decade.
